intro: Crotalaria helenae, commonly known as the Helen's crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod-like fruits and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with palmate leaves and showy yellow or orange flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens, though it can become invasive in some areas.
